metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6638 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple buffer overflows in runtime.cc in Google V8 before 3.22.24.7, as used in Google Chrome before 31.0.1650.63, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors that trigger a large typed array, related to the (1) Runtime_TypedArrayInitialize and (2) Runtime_TypedArrayInitializeFromArrayLike functions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-chromedriver - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
